servers.description: Gambit Communications MIMIC simulator REST API

info.description: This is the API for MIMIC client to connect to MIMIC daemon.
info.title: MIMIC REST API

get.summary: The maximum number of agent instances.
get.description: The maximum number of agent instances.

get.summary: The last configured agent instance.
get.description: The last configured agent instance.

get.summary: The version of the MIMIC command interface.
get.description: The version of the MIMIC command interface.

get.summary: The number of clients currently connected to the daemon.
get.description: The number of clients currently connected to the daemon.

get.summary: The currently loaded lab configuration file for the particular user.
get.description: In the case of multi-user access this command returns a different configuration file loaded for each user.

get.summary: This predicate indicates if the currently loaded agent configuration file has changed.
get.description: Whether the loaded agent configuration file has changed since the last time this predicate was queried. This allows for a client to detect agent configuration changes and to synchronize those changes from the MIMIC daemon.

get.summary: The return mode.
get.description: The OpenAPI daemon operates in two modes, nocatch, where error returns from MIMIC operations return error; or catch, where the TCL catch semantics are used (these are similar to C++ exceptions)

get.summary: The current log file for the Simulator.
get.description: The current log file for the Simulator.

get.summary: The set of protocols supported by the Simulator.
get.description: The set of protocols supported by the Simulator.

get.summary: The set of network interfaces that can be used for simulations.
get.description: The set of network interfaces that can be used for simulations.

get.summary: The product number that is licensed.
get.description: The product number that is licensed.

get.summary: The network address of the host where the MIMIC simulator is running.
get.description: The network address of the host where the MIMIC simulator is running.

get.summary: The default network device to be used for agent addresses.
get.description: The default network device to be used for agent addresses if the interface is not explicitly specified for an agent.

get.summary: The list of {agentnum} that are currently configured.
get.description: This list is guaranteed to be sorted into increasing order.

get.summary: The list of {agentnum} that are currently active (running or paused).
get.description: This list is guaranteed to be sorted into increasing order.

get.summary: The list of {agentnum {statistics}} for agents that are currently active and whose statistics have changed since the last invocation of this command.
get.description: This list is guaranteed to be sorted into increasing order.

get.summary: The list of {agentnum} for which a configurable parameter changed.
get.description: This list contains at most 5000 agent(s), and is guaranteed to be sorted into increasing order.

get.summary: The list of {agentnum state} for which the state changed.
get.description: This list contains at most 5000 agent(s), and is guaranteed to be sorted into increasing order.

get.summary: Get multiple sets of information about MIMIC, where infoArray is one of the parameters defined in the mimic get command.
get.description: Get multiple sets of information about MIMIC, where infoArray is one of the parameters defined in the mimic get command.

put.summary: The current log file for the Simulator.
put.description: The current log file for the Simulator.

requestBody.description: The file name of the new log file

put.summary: The network address of the host where the MIMIC simulator is running.
put.description: The network address of the host where the MIMIC simulator is running.

put.summary: This operation flushes all global objects which need to be made persistent to disk.
put.description: The MIMIC daemon caches persistent objects and their changes, and writes them to disk at program termination. If it were to crash, these changes would be lost. This operation allows to checkpoint the cache, ie. write changes to persistent objects to disk. To save the lab configuration with per-agent persistent information the mimic save operation needs to be used.

put.summary: Load the lab configuration file file.
put.description: Load agents in cfgFile from firstAgentNum to lastAgentNum on startAgentNum of current configuration

parameters.name: cfgFile
parameters.description: MIMIC agent configuration file to load

parameters.name: firstAgentNum
parameters.description: Agent number in cfgFile to start the loading

parameters.name: lastAgentNum
parameters.description: Agent number in cfgFile to end the loading

parameters.name: startAgentNum
parameters.description: Agent number in current configuration to start placing the new agents

put.summary: Clear the lab configuration.

parameters.name: lastAgentNum
parameters.description: Agent number to end the clearing

put.summary: Save the lab configuration in file.
put.description: Save the lab configuration in file.

parameters.name: cfgFile
parameters.description: MIMIC agent configuration file to save

parameters.name: firstAgentNum
parameters.description: Agent number in cfgFile to start the loading

parameters.name: lastAgentNum
parameters.description: Agent number in cfgFile to end the loading

put.summary: Save the lab configuration.
Start MIMIC.
Stop MIMIC.
Terminate the MIMIC daemon.

put.summary: Start the current agent.
put.description: For speed, this operation will complete asynchronously. A successful return from this command means the starting of the agent is in progress. If you need to rely on the agent to have completed startup, you should wait for it's state to become RUNNING.

put.summary: Reload the current agent.
put.description: This only works for halted agents. The net effect is the same as restarting an agent (ie. stop, start, halt), but without disconnecting the network (and thus existing connections).

get.summary: Lists all the additional ipaliases configured for the agent.
get.description: The agent host address (set with mimic agent set host) is not in this list, since it is already accessible separately with mimic agent get host.

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show the IP alias list

post.summary: Adds a new ipalias for the agent.
post.description: port defaults to 161 if not specified. mask defaults to the class-based network mask for the address. interface defaults to the default network interface.  If port is set to 0, the system will automatically select a port number. This is useful for client-mode protocols, such as TFTP or TOD. Upon start of an IP alias with a 0 (auto-assigned) port number, its port will change to contain the value of the selected system port.

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to add the IP alias

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: SNMP port , 0 or empty for default

delete.description: port defaults to 161 if not specified.

get.summary: List the source addresses that the agent will accept messages from.
get.description: This in effect implements source-address-indexing, where 2 agents with the same address can be configured, each accepting messages from different management stations.

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show the IP sources

post.summary: Add a source address that the agent will accept messages from.
post.description: An empty ipaddress or 0.0.0.0 both imply any address. Similarly an empty port or 0 both imply any port. For agents with source-address-indexing enabled, messages which do not match any source address will be discarded with an ERROR message, similar to community string mismatches.

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to add the IP source

parameters.name: IP
parameters.description: IP of the port, 0.0.0.0 for any

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: port of the source, 0 for any

delete.summary: delete a source address that the agent will accept messages from.
delete.description: An empty ipaddress or 0.0.0.0 both imply any address. Similarly an empty port or 0 both imply any port. For agents with source-address-indexing enabled, messages which do not match any source address will be discarded with an ERROR message, similar to community string mismatches.

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to delete the IP source

put.summary: Set a variable in the Value Space.
put.description: NOTE to set a binary string value, specify a string starting with \\x followed by pairs of hexadecimal digits, eg. "\\x 01 23 45". This command also assigns SNMP PDU action scripts for GET* and SET requests on a MIB object. The instance parameter must be 0. The following variables enable actions, g - The specified TCL script will be run on GET or GETNEXT requests. It has to exist under the simulation directory. s - The specified script will be run on SET requests. It has to exist under the simulation directory. This command also controls advanced trap generation functionality. The following variables control trap generation r, tu, c - These variables together represent the rate settings for the trap. r and tu is the actual per second rate and c represents the total duration in seconds for which the trap is sent. As soon as the c variable is set, the trap generation begins, for this reason it should be the last variable set for a particular trap. The following variables have to be set before setting the c variable to modify the behavior of the generated trap(s). OBJECT - An object name when used as a variable is looked up during the trap send and the value of that variable is included in the PDU. OBJECT.i - This type of variable will be used to assign an optional instance for the specified object in the traps varbind. The value of this variable identifies the index. e.g. The commands below will send ifIndex.2 with a value of 5 in the linkUp trap PDU. i - This variable is used to specify any extra version specific information to the trap generation code. Here is what it can be used to represent for various SNMP versions SNMPv1 - [community_string][,[enterprise][,agent_addr]] SNMPv2c - community_string SNMPv2 - source_party,destination_party,context SNMPv3 - user_name,context v - This variable lets the user override the version of the PDU being generated. The possible values are - "1", "2c", "2" and "3". o - This variable is used for traps that need extra variables to be added to the PDU along with the ones defined in the MIB as its variables. This lets the user force extra objects (along with instances if needed). All variables to be sent need to be assigned to the o variable. O - To omit any variables which are defined in the MIB you can use the O (capital o) variable. This needs to be set to the list of OIDs of the variable bindings in the order defined in the MIB. ip - The variable ip is used for generating the trap from the N-th IP alias address. a - This variable associates an action script to the trap or INFORM request. The action script specified in the value of this variable has to exist in the simulation directory. It will be executed before each instance of the trap is sent out. I - This optional variable controls the generation of INFORM PDUs. An INFORM is sent only if the variable is non-zero, else a TRAP is generated. R, T, E - This variable associates an action script to the INFORM request. The action script specified in the value of this variable has to exist in the simulation directory. The action script associated with the R variable will be executed on receiving a INFORM RESPONSE, the one associated with the T variable on a timeout (ie. no response), the one associated with the E variable on a report PDU. eid.IP-ADDRESS.PORT - control variable allows to configure message authoritative engine id for the destination specified by IP-ADDRESS and optionally by PORT. eb.IP-ADDRESS.PORT - control variable allows to configure message authoritative engine boots. et.IP-ADDRESS.PORT - control variable allows to configure message authoritative engine time.

parameters.description: Single instance object or object (column) of the table in the agent's value space.

get.summary: Get the state of a MIB object object.
get.description: To disable traversal into a MIB object and any subtree underneath, set the state to 0, else set the state to 1.

put.summary: Set the state of a MIB object object
put.description: To disable traversal into a MIB object and any subtree underneath, set the state to 0, else set the state to 1.

put.summary: Set the variable store for the global storage
These commands allow the creation of a new variable, or changing an existing value.
put.description: The append sub-command will append the value to an existing variable, or create a new one. The set sub-command will overwrite an existing variable, or create a new one. The optional persist flag can be used to indicate if the variable is to be persistent as described above. By default a value of '0' will be implied for the persist flag. To avoid mistakes, for existing variables the persist flag can only be set. If you want to reset it, you first need to unset the variable.

put.summary: These commands treat the variable as a list, and allow to replace an entry in the list at the specified index with the specified value. The variable has to already exist.
put.description: These commands treat the variable as a list, and allow to replace an entry in the list at the specified index with the specified value. The variable has to already exist.

put.summary: These commands treat the variable as a list, and allow to replace an entry in the list at the specified index with the specified value. The variable has to already exist.
put.description: These commands treat the variable as a list, and allow to replace an entry in the list at the specified index with the specified value. The variable has to already exist.

put.summary: Deletes a variable which is currently defined.
put.description: This will cleanup persistent variables if needed

get.description: The value will be returned as a string (like all Tcl values).

get.summary: Fetches the value associated with a variable.
get.description: The value will be returned as a string (like all Tcl values).

get.summary: This command can be used as a predicate to ascertain the existence of a given variable.
get.description: It returns "1" if the variable exists, else "0".

get.summary: List the timer scripts currently running along with the their intervals.
get.description: The command mimic timer script list lists global timer scripts, the command /mimic/timer/script/{agentNum}/list is the per-agent equivalent NOTE Global timer scripts run globally but within them you can address individual agents using {agentNum}. To schedule timerscripts for an individual agent, use /mimic/timer/script/{agentNum}.

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to return the timer script list

get.summary: List the timer scripts currently running along with the their intervals.
get.description: The command mimic timer script list lists global timer scripts, the command /mimic/timer/script/{agentNum}/list is the per-agent equivalent NOTE Global timer scripts run globally but within them you can address individual agents using {agentNum}. To schedule timerscripts for an individual agent, use /mimic/timer/script/{agentNum}.

post.summary: Add a new timer script to be executed at specified interval (in msec) with the specified argument.
post.description: Add a new timer script to be executed at specified interval (in msec) with the specified argument.

parameters.description: Agent to return the timer script list

post.summary: Add a new timer script to be executed at specified interval (in msec) with the specified argument.
post.description: Add a new timer script to be executed at specified interval (in msec) with the specified argument.

delete.summary: Remove a timer script from the execution list.

get.description: 0 - stopped, 2 - disconnected, 3 - connecting, 4 - connected, 5 - waiting for CONNACK, 6 - waiting for SUBACK, 7 - CONNACK received, in steady state

put.summary: Set the agent's MQTT TCP connection target broker
Set the agent's MQTT TCP connection target port
Set the agent's MQTT client ID
Set the agent's MQTT client username
Set the agent's MQTT client password
Set the agent's MQTT client will's topic
put.description: Will topic for the will message

put.summary: Set the agent's MQTT client's will
Set the agent's MQTT retained will
Set the agent's MQTT will message's QOS field
Set the agent's MQTT session
Set the agent's MQTT TCP keepalive
Set the agent's MQTT disconnection action
put.description: Action to take when MQTT session is disconnected

put.summary: Abort agent's MQTT TCP session without sending DISCONNECT command
Disconnect agent's MQTT TCP session by sending DISCONNECT command
Start agent's MQTT TCP session

get.summary: Show the agent's current messages' cardinality
get.description: 0 or more

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show MQTT message state

get.summary: Show the agent's message attributes
get.description: Attribute can be topic, interval, count, sent , pre, post, properties(list of PUBLISH properties), properties.i (i-th PUBLISH property), properties.PROP-NAME (PUBLISH property with name PROP-NAME)

put.summary: Set the agent's message attributes
put.description: Attribute can not be sent or properties . Use set/{msgNum}/count/{value} together with get/{msgNum}/count to throttle the outgoing MQTT message to the broker.

get.summary: Show the agent's current subscriptions' cardinality
get.description: 0 or more

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show MQTT subscription state

get.summary: Show the agent's subscription attributes
get.description: Attribute can be topic, properties(list of SUBSCRIBE properties), properties.i (i-th SUBSCRIBE property), properties.PROP-NAME (SUBSCRIBE property with name PROP-NAME)

put.summary: Stops receiving messages from a subcription of the agent
Restart receiving messages from a subcription of the agent
Set the agent's subscribe attributes

get.summary: Show the agent's COAP argument structure
get.description: Agent's COAP configuration with port,rule,prompt,paging_prompt,userdb,keymap

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show the COAP argument structure

get.summary: Show the agent's COAP configuration
get.description: Agent's COAP configuration with port,rule,prompt,paging_prompt,userdb,keymap

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show the COAP configuration

put.summary: Set the agent's COAP configuration

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to set the COAP configuration

parameters.name: argument
parameters.description: Parameter to set the COAP configuration

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Value to set the COAP configuration

get.summary: Show the agent's COAP traffic tracing
get.description: Trace 1 means enabled, 0 means not

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to show whether COAP tracing is enabled

put.summary: Set the agent's COAP traffic tracing

parameters.name: agentNum
parameters.description: Agent to set the COAP tracing

parameters.name: enableOrNot
parameters.description: Value to set the COAP tracing

get.summary: Show the COAP statistics headers
get.description: The headers of statistics fields

get.summary: Show the agent's COAP statistics
get.description: Statistics of fields indicated in the headers

get.summary: Returns the current administrator.
get.description: If nothing is specified in admin/settings.cfg then returns "".

get.summary: Returns the current admin directory.
get.description: If nothing is specified in admin/settings.cfg then returns "". If no admin directory is specified then the shared area will be used where needed (e.g. for persistent info, access control data files etc. )

get.summary: Returns the current access control database in use.
get.description: If nothing is specified then this returns "".

put.summary: Allows setting the name of the current access control database.
put.description: This will be used for subsequent load and save operations.

get.summary: Returns the state of access control checking.
get.description: 0 indicates that it is disabled, 1 indicates it is enabled.

put.summary: Allows the user to enable/disable the access control check.
Loads the specified file for access control data.
put.description: If filename is not specified then the currently set 'acldb' parameter is used.

put.summary: Saves current access control data in specified file.
put.description: If filename is not specified then the currently set 'acldb' parameter is used.

get.summary: Returns an array of entries.
get.description: Each entry consists of user, agents (in minimal range representation) and access mask (not used currently).

post.summary: Adds/Overwrites the user entry in the access control database.
post.description: Adds/Overwrites the user entry in the access control database.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: Username of the simulator hosting system

parameters.name: agents
parameters.description: Agent range in minimal range representation

delete.summary: Clears a users entry from access control database.
delete.description: Using '*' for user clears all the users.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: username of the simulator hosting system
